revised_title: Frederick Wallace Edwards: A Pioneering Entomologist and Expert on Mosquitoes
tldr: Frederick Wallace Edwards was a prominent entomologist who specialized in the study of mosquitoes and Diptera. He worked at the British Museum and made significant contributions to the understanding of mosquito taxonomy, systematics, and biology. His research on mosquito larvae, male genitalia, and classification helped improve the identification and study of these insects, which are crucial for human welfare and disease control.
